Reviews.Title: “Awful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: KmkaCanberra
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in a superior twin room with my 86 year old mother, I discovered that there was shower over the bath. I immediately went back to reception and requested another room as a shower over a bath is too tricky for someone with a significant visual impairment. The young woman on the front desk was very helpful and courteous and arranged for us to move to another room. She did say that a superior room meeting our needs would not be available and my response was that a suitable bathroom with a shower recess was my priority. We were given the keys to a room on the 3rd floor with, what I was told, was a bathroom equipped for the disabled. The reality was that the bathroom had a shower and curtain over what was once a shower cubicle. The walls of the cubicle had been removed and tiles placed over the gap where the cubicle wall had once stood. This had been done in a very shoddy way and actually made a trip obstacle on the floor. The shower curtain was probably 30cms or more off the floor and the floor was not designed for the water to run down the drain, keeping the rest of the room dry. As a result the bathroom was very hazardous. The floor was wet and slippery everywhere. The basin was just that. There was nowhere to place any toiletries so an old lady had to bend down and reach for things on a slippery floor. NOT GOOD ENOUGH!!! It was very disappointing as my husband, an Accor A Club member, booked the room. It was far from what we have come to expect from a Mercure and I will not return to this hotel. If you have special needs be very wary!

Reviews.Title: “EMERGENCY, EVACUATE!”
Reviews.Author: mrkennethlo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in the middle of Kings Cross, and actually just on top of the metro station. Traveling around is easy and convenient. My room (Bay's View) was fairly spacious and comfortable, and everything in the room is well maintained and working properly. However, after dark the district is kind of complicated with bar and clubs around - which means people getting happy, drunk and noisy right in front of your door. You can enjoy the music together with them after the middle of the night with them even you are in the room. Request to stay on higher floors if you are sensitive sleepers. Also, during my stay due to whatever reason, the fire alarm was activated and all guests are requested to evacuate by a systematic voice - "EMERGENCY, EVACUATE" in the room. While later on it was found to be a false alarm. From a positive view, this unique experience suggested that the hotel indeed has a working fire alarm system. But I would expect somebody from the hotel explaining what was happening before a casual staff simply telling us to go back to our room in the fire staircase in the middle of my evacuations. Another thing worth mentioning is - if you are driving and planning to have your vehicle staying under the same roof in the hotel with you during the stay, make sure that you are skillful driver. The hotel underground parking lot is particularly compact and require a lot of attention and skill to move your vehicle into and out of it. I understand it is a very old building and probably it was not designed to cater modern cars. Overall this hotel score a passing mark - and I would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: paninamana
Reviews.Content: Just returned from here. Not bad really but more of 3 stars than 4. Rooms are clean and tidy when I first got in. Furnishings are alright, minimal and practical. However, I feel that the room's space was not utilised to the fullest. Could do a bit more with the extra space next to the windows. Staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was okay. I noticed that they aren't as thorough as they should be. Some hair left behind in the showers and beds not tucked in as nicely as it should be. I don't mind it but some others might. Also, on my second night, I noticed a large stain outside my room. Looked a bit like vomit or some sort of liquid stain. Didn't get cleaned up until I left which was 2 nights later. Details like this should be considered by the hotel. The hotel is located right in Kings Cross despite the name being Mercure Sydney Potts Points so I suggest that people with kids or anyone in general should be a little more careful there, given the rowdy nature of that area especially on weekend nights. I quite enjoyed my stay otherwise and pricing was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: john683
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Mercure and have had a quick look at what other people have written...a couple of people have been critical of the staff - this is the exact opposite of my experience. I found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful. On the positive side this hotel is in a great location on the city fringe. There is a Coles supermarket close by, and the hotel is literally right next to the Kings Cross subway station. On the down side, the rooms either face the Holiday Inn and harbour or Kings Cross, I had a room facing Kings Cross and there was a lot of noise. The other thing which is very misleading is that their advertising says that the hotel was completely refurbished in 2010. The room I was in looked like it hadnt been touched in 20 years. I noticed a room across the corridor being serviced and had a look in and it was completely different to mine - it was very modern and clearly had been recently refurbished. The room I was in would have been lucky to scrape to three stars, not the four stars claimed. I think management should amend their advertising to "SOME rooms were refurbished in 2010". Having said all that the room was very clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “No Porters, No Seafood”
Reviews.Author: John590
Reviews.Content: We found the staff quite officious while registering but gave them the benefit of the doubt as they had to deal with 'mass' registration for an 'overnight' due to a lost connection to Johannesburg. However a young chap went out of his way to find a cellphone charger as ours was hard to get to in security wrapped luggage. Accommodation was a nice surprise as we've overnighted in Mercure Barcelona and swore never to set foot in a Mercure again due to their appalling housekeeping standards. Menu was limited, both dinner and breakfast and we were very surprised not to find seafood, not even fish on the menu, especially as Sydney is practically surrounded by water. Excellent Restaurant staff, all very friendly and helpful. NO PORTERS though and we had to queue for the hotel luggage trolleys. After a very loong, frustrating, tiring day, once we managed to secure a trolley we did not even bother to return it to the foyer but kept if till the next morning. Not sure of location in terms of sightseeing but will definitely overnight again if occasion arises.

Reviews.Title: “Russion prison camp influence”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: April 2-6, 2012 After a 23 hour travel from NYC - LAX - SYD, we were happy to have checked in earlier than normal check in time. It wasn't until later that night, after we had unpacked and returned to the room, that we went to take a shower. This room has a completely flat tiled floor, with the shower behind a flimsy curtain. There is no rim to hold in the water, so when you shower, the water, and soap, runs amok all over the floor. You pull back the sad little curtain, and you are left standing in a pool of water, a lawsuit, waiting to happen. It is off-putting, awkward, and makes us think of Russian prison camp bathroom movie scenes. Now, onto the internet. Don't even think of checking in on more than 3 email messages. The internet service costs $30 for a 24 hour period, and has a limit of 100 mbgs. The people that devised this structure, evidently did so more than 10 years ago. It is the most archaic, cumbersome, and expensive plan in the world! Upon checkout, when the desk staff asked if we enjoyed our stay, we said "no". And then told them of the issues, detailed above. The young man was unaffected. His female co-worker, looked on in amazement at his skill in keeping a straight face. The Accor group can do, and should do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, though a touch disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrevor
Reviews.Content: For a hotal claiming a four star rating, it does not live up to that expectation. If they claimed to be a three or even three & a half star, it would have met my expectations above and beyond, but it really falls short of the minimum I'd expect of a four star establishment. A few examples: I was upgraded to a "Delux" room (courtesy of my LeClub membership). If that room was Delux, then I cannot imagine what a basic room must be. The Delux was very cramped and tiny as too was its bathroom. It was a room for two, but only had seating for one. There was no porter / bell boy service.No-one to carry your bags up to your room or bring them back down when you leave. As I am mobility impaired and on a walking stick, this is one reason I stay in four star establishments and it is a service that any establishment claiming to be four star SHOULD have. Staff were not friendly. They weren't rude either, but none at any time made any special efforts, not even to ask "How are you this morning, sir?" at breakfast. Those points aside, in favour was that the entire establish has been recently refurbished to a high standard. Everything is perfectly clean and tidy, looking brand new, everything works. As I started this review by saying, if this place claimed to be 3 or even 3.5 star rated, it would have met my expectations and beyond. If what you are seeking is something in that 3 to 3.5 star range, I'd recommend this establishment. It just isn't the claimed four star.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Seyahbiz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonable for business, perhaps a better hotel if you are on holidays due to proximity to the city. Positives: Room and bed nice, ample variety of food both restaurant and takeaway outside the door; it's right next to the train station. My room had a nice panoramic view of the entire city from Centrepoint to the Harbour Bridge. Negatives: The hotel had an overseas tourist group in and I couldn't get a seat - nor a plate- when I went down for breakfast the first day. I ended up going outside the hotel for breakfast. ...a bit of an inconvenience as I had a time schedule to stick to due to business meetings. There was also no desk in my room so work and dinner had to be done on my bed. My room had no minibar, although when I stayed at the same hotel chain's inner city hotel, that room did. Go figure... Also water pressure for cold water in the hotel very poor, meaning a delicate balancing act between being scolded and frozen when taking a shower. Do yourself a favour and eat breakfast at Olivetto, just up the street in Bayswater Rd! Great Italian cafe with very friendly staff and great food. I have eaten here a few times now, and great for a quick and quality meal. I do feel that Sydney hotels are getting overpriced for what you get. I piad $260 for a Tuesday night at this hotel, a figure that gets me 5 star when I stay in other great cities around the region. Internet is on top at $29 per day. It's shame that I can't get consistent quality and price anymore in Sydney. You take pot luck. I guess that's why I will never be loyal to one chain as they do not seem to really value repeat business anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: PoshTravla
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed here for about a week long visit to Sydney. The room was a "Superior 1 Queen Bed Harbour View." It was a very comfortable room, with an excellent view of the city Westfield tower, harbour (saw a mini firework show from my window), and the Opera House. Didn't have any issues with the water pressure in the shower, but it was a very slow draining tub. The only snafu was switching the shower head on, which the manager on duty that night graciously came by to fix. Aside from that, it was a decent stay. The location of the hotel was in a convenient spot, with easy access to get around the city (you can't lose with the King's Cross subway stop right across the street), and plenty of food options up the block. The hotel interior is very trendy, with tufted square ottomans giving the lobby an edge. Oh, and the breakfast buffet wasn't too bad (plenty of choices). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “On the wrong side of Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: worddict
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incorrectly called Mercure Sydney Potts Point. The train station right below it is King's Cross, a rather unsavoury part of town. It isn't too bad, but you won't want to walk around alone at night. Siren wails are frequently heard in the middle of the night. As are the loud bawdy laughs of drunken patrons at nearby pubs. The hotel itself was clean with largish rooms. On one side, some rooms get the view of the Holiday Inn and the Sydney Opera House. On the other side, the hustle and bustle of King's Cross and Bada Bing, and an assortment of adult themed entertainment. The TV in my room did not work. Although I was barely in the room, it didn't really matter. The tap in the bathroom sink flew off and water spewed to the ceiling. However, I managed to screw the tap back in. It was an easy fix. The towels were not always changed when I threw them into a bathtub - a usual sign for most hotels that guests want their towels replaced. The breakfast selection seemed okay, but I didn't actually eat anything except the fruit. Service was slow. Tables were messy and dirty and weren't cleared away quickly. Internet access is not free. $10 an hour or use the public terminals. Across the road, above Coles supermarket, is another public internet service kiosk with much lower connection fees. However, I didn't use that. I used the data plan of my mobile phone. Twice I got the hotel to book the taxi, but they didn't arrive. Instead I had to flag one off the road. Late checkout will cost you $20 an hour. The hotel itself wasn't terrible, but I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for sightseeing and nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Eddwina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were pleasantly surpised. This hotel is in a great spot and we got an upgrade to a huge aprtment. The train station is just across the road and there are lots of restaurants around, not to mention Coles and Fitness first a stones throw away. The hotel doesnÂ´t have a gym so they let you use fitness first which is great. The hotel is very quiet, modern and clean. We stayed here because we were hunting for an apartment after our return to Sydney - but if I was a tourist this would be a top hotel at 139 a night. 5 mins to the city on the train and if youÂ´re that way inclined Kings Cross has the nightlife on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Mecure”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Mercure Sydney Potts Point for one night after flying into Australia from the USA. The hotel has had some recent updates / renovations however the furniture in the room was old and as others have commented, the water pressure in the shower was poor. The location is quite good, easily within walking distance of everything in central Sydney, or an easy and quick train ride away from downtown. The train station is located right next to the hotel and just one stop away and you are in the heart of Sydney. The cost for in room internet is ridiculous but then again it seems to be this way at most hotels in Australia for some reason. Staff were very polite and helpful and I would likely stay again as the price was definitely right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the location scare you away.”
Reviews.Author: AM2_Toronto
Reviews.Content: The Mecure Potts Point was a great landing place after a long flight from Canada. I just want a hotel where I could catch up with my sleep, in a safe neighborhood and close to transit. That's what I got. It's easy to get here from the airport by transit and the hotel is right outside the Kings Cross station. Even though Kings Cross is known as the red light district, don't let that scare you away. The location is fine, maybe just a bit more colourful. I stayed in room 405 and it was quiet and I could see the Opera House, the bridge and the skyline from my window. It was great. The shower had some temperature issues. Hot then cold then really hot. The desk staff were very helpful and were able to get me checked in early which was a huge help. They were happy to help with suggestions and directions. I would recommend this hotel. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “More proactive service required”
Reviews.Author: Kiwia1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a wotif deal. Fine for one night and close to everything. The thing I did not like was that they put me in a room in which the room safe was not working. With limited time in Sydney I had to mess around with a change in rooms. Many people carry valuables with them when they travel including iPads and tablet computers. Surely housekeeping can ensure room safes work on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Services and Room design”
Reviews.Author: Benny C
Reviews.Content: Since the other hotels in CBD are full. My travel department booked this hotel for me. It is nightmare! First, I am business traveller and need to work with laptop. But you can't find any power socket nearby the work desk. It is far away (2M). The network cable they are provided is not enough length as well. I need work on the TV cabinet to connect network and power instead of work desk. The wireless is charged AUD 10 per hour. The air-con outlet direct face the bed and same high level with the bed. It means whole night be blown directly or turn the air-con off or find something cover it. I made a request to change room at first night around 11:30pm due to above reasons. The staff told me all the room design are same (I don't believe it). I had asked him to doing someting and should have some room have better design. He told me it is full house tonight and come down to front desk on next morning. It is fair and I had asked him to make some note in their system. He said already made it in system. On next morning, I went to front desk doing the same after breakfast. The female front desk staff said the check out time is 11:00am and should be available afterward and come back after 11am. I went out for few business meetings and call in at 1pm to check availability. The female staff said should be okay after a hour and I told her still have meetings to go and back on around 4pm. The told me should be no problem. After meeting, I had taken a cab from my meeting place back to hotel. It is cost me AUD33. I check with front desk girl about the change room. Then she asked me what is the reason need change the room. I had explained again the reason then she told me full house again. I had request talk to duty manager and he asked me what reason need change the room. His model answer again all room design is same, no room better your room now, full house, pay 20 dollars upgrade, etc. finally, he said give me the power extension. I had asked him why your staff didn't give me the power extension on last night? Why your staff said can change room but suddenly cannot. He is refused to answer my questions and just pass me the power extension. If you have choice, pls avoid this hotel. I can't said they don't have any service. They don't know what is the customer satisfaction. The room is total rubbish and not worth what you paid.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Advanatge Plus Members Beware”
Reviews.Author: TheSlothMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Having been Accor Advantage Plus members for many years we stayed at this hotel recently. As usual, Accor members do not get the right deals, and Iv'e said this before, members pay for the discounts they get in an annual fee. There were deals in Brisbane newspapers offering more than Accor Advantage Plus can. People who are not Accor members could get cheaper rooms including breakfast. This is what makes Advantage Plus members lose faith. Accor is supposed to guarantee that members will always get better than any advertised deals at a particular establishment, no matter what site the deal is on. Clearly this is still not happening, even though they, (Accor), say this will always be the case. And Accor members also get the less favourable rooms, never a Harbor view, just the basic rooms. Accor needs to remember that their members payments help prop up the business, and should be permitted to have just as good rooms as "full paying" customers. It's not like the hotel would have Advantage Plus members filling it up every night. Accor and irs hotel chain need to wake up and treat members with a bit more thanks. They sell these memberships, but won't match or beat prices from other agencies.

Reviews.Title: “Eye Opener In The Middle of the Cross”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at The Mecure, Potts Point, as we wanted a view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from our room - it didn't dissapoint us at all. Kings Cross as you can image was pumping all Friday and Saturday night but the change in atmosphere was just what we needed coming from a sleepy country town. The staff were excellent, even from the first phone call when we couldn't locate the motel - the young receptionist directed us in with ease. The boys at breakfast were extremly friendly and couldn't do enough to assist us even making my wife a "French Capacino" to get her day started. The Room we stayed in was large and more than comfortable. OVerall it was located in a great position and we would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: boybandlad
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried as I knew this hotel was re branded & renovated recently (certainly needed it) & with the great price i wasnt expecting much...but it was better than ok! The staff were all helpful & friendly! I needed there help with some air con issues as this is an old building - they were up in less than 5 minutes! The wifi purchasing is confusing and not so good..area is awesome - top of the city, close to the dodgyness of kings X but you can walk out without being affected!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight City Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used our complimentary night to stay here as we were meeting a group for dinner in Woolloomooloo. It was very convenient. The staff were very friendly, in fact they upgraded us to a suite which was nice, alhough not quite what I expected. It was a room the same size as the bedroom with two small chairs and a table - a bit odd, perhaps a lounge might have worked to fill the space and add more comfort. Dispite that we really enjoyed our overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Handy loctaion / just outside the city Core”
Reviews.Author: Roddever Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on in January 2012. The hotel is well located unstairs to the the Kings Cross Station so access is easy if you are not driving. The staff are freindly and the hotel is well appointed. If you are a people watcher (lol) try a drink in the bar off the lobby as you can see the kings cross strip and its interesting characters. The areas is fine.. despite the images that Kings Cross conjures up in the mind. (too much underbelly for some). A good hotel that has value for money and decent accomidation. Id stay again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location but has a very average standard of service. Hotel is really Kings Cross, not Potts Point being situated above Kings Cross Train Station. Staff were ok in person at front desk but were of little help over the phone

Reviews.Title: “Noty bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Travelman2500
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times over the last few months and find it good value. Reception is on level 2 where you need to check in and obtain your electronic security card to your room (and also for hotel and lift access) so a fairly secure and safe hotel to stay at , despited the location. Rooms are fine, clean and spacious. Beds are comfortable and I find the rooms pretty quiet throughout the night. Its a great location if you are going to sporting events at the SCG or Football stadium as it is about a 20min walk (avoiding the ludicrous sydney traffic and parking fees). There is a Fitness First centre literally 1 minute away, as well as a Coles supermarket. Overall I look forward to staying there again, Reception was prompt and efficient (Checked in with the lovely Erin both times) and the rooms are more than adequate

Reviews.Title: “TOO much noise and dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: natalie g
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our stay over New Year and was utterly disappointed. We booked through a travel agent and was told that we had a superior â€˜â€™Bay Viewâ€™ room. There was nothing superior about the room - it was merely average and the only view we had was of the strip club below. If you squinted your eyes you might make out the top of some boat masts in the far distance, but you would be far from seeing a boat or even water. Our room was on level 10 and I was kept awake until 4:00 am on morning. A tip for the hotel would be to supply your guests with ear plugs or even install double glazing because the noise outside is unbearable in the early hours of the morning. When you stay at a 4* hotel you expect the little extras like clean towels; most days out of our 5 we arrived home to damp towels. Reception staff at our check in was fine but it would have been nice to been notified of the hotels facilities, where the restaurant was and maybe been offered if they could help with any restaurant reservations esc. We had the manager check us out at 4:00 am he was friendly, helpful and efficient. All in all we was excited for our trip to Sydney and was let down by our room and we will not be staying there again. We knew that New Year prices are more expensive and the price didnâ€™t bother us but this hotel was a rip off for what we got! My advice donâ€™t stay there find somewhere else of better quality for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BJ216
Reviews.Content: This is a belated review from our stay here in March 2011. Having lived in Sydney for 10 years, we were excited to return for a concert and stay at this "new" hotel in Potts Point. Firstly, this hotel is actually in Kings Cross .. not Potts Point. I could get over this exaggeration because of the convenience of being opposite Kings Cross station. However when we got there, we also found it is opposite an extremely popular all-night night club that had a noisy line-up half a block long to get in. Also, by "new" they meant a really old building with new (very dark) paint, carpet, and furniture. The dark furniture and furnishings, particularly in the hallway, gave it the seedy Kings Cross feel of yester-year. That said the rooms were clean, and a decent size. The staff were friendly, however at peak check-in and check-out times there was often only one person on the poorly located front desk, creating a large queue and long delays.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very noisy being right in kings cross action small bathroom with no ventillation fan over priced for what the room was no under mattress protector/blanket under bottom sheet so we were sleeping straight on plastic protector on mattress - not very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Review Mercure Sydney Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: msml1947
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not at Potts Point but is in Kings Cross, and the only advantage is the proximity of the station in an area which is somewhat smutty. There is substantial noise from the nightlife on Friday and Saturday night revellers, so ask for a room on the "harbour" side. The cheaper rooms on the lower floors have inadequate furniture, are bare, and are too near the noise of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic accommodation...nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Steege51
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in early December after a work Christmas party inhouse. The rate was very attractive as it was equal to the cost of a taxi ride home. It was a little confusing locating the 'lobby', as I arrived in a type of basement area and waited (what seemed an eternity) for the lift to go up to the lobby. The check in was a relatively quick and pleasant process. The room itself is fairly basic, all the necessities expected for a hotel of this branding, and in good condition,but nothing extra special or flash - but that was Ok, I wasn't planning on spending a lot of time in there. I was glad I brought my ear plugs as I had expected the outside streetnoise to be noticeable, and it was. The floor I was on had a large 'No Smoking' sign outside the elevator, but I don't recall this being pointed out to me at check in, During the night, I was disturbed twice by the OVERWHELMING smell of cigarette smoke coming from the room next door.It seems the Korean gentlemen in that room had not been informed either regarding the no smoking floor or simply chose to ignore it.Just yuk - I had to bury my head under the sheets to get away from it. breakfast the next morning was cheapish - just under $20, but a really simple buffet with limited choices.I left straight after that -check out was a bit prolonged due to some early morning arrivals wondering why their rooms were not ready at 8.30am...... the hotel is only a few steps away from the railway station, so I was out and on the train very quickly. All in all, it was what I expected for a one night stay - If I was a tourist visiting Sydney for a longer stay, it would be OK, as long as you weren't planning on spending any 'down' time relaxing in your hotel room - it would be a bit boring I would think.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: felicia B
Reviews.Content: We took three rooms at the Mercure for my mum & dad, son, and wife and myself for three days from 10 Dec. 2011. Getting there from the International Airport was quick and easy - taxi driver knew the Hotel by name. We arrived very early so the reception held our luggage and we explored Kings Cross where we had not been for 20 years - safe, interesting and cosmopolitan. The Hotels breakfast was standard, coffee was better at a cafe 50m down the road called Joe's The rooms were of a good size and met our needs. The staff were great everytime we met up with them. We stayed 3 nights and must say it was perfect for what we wanted as we did not want the hustle and bustle of the city. We had a great dinner at a Vietnamese restaurant in Springfield Lane, a short walk from the hotel called Bayboa. For us it ticked all the boxes, safe, comfortable, friendly, clean, value and exactly where we wanted to be in relation to location. Mike & Flo Brown

Reviews.Title: “Had a wondeful stay at Mercure Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at your hotel. Your staff were very friendly and helpful. The view over Sydney Harbour from the 12th floor was just spectacular. Just one question, why can't the hotel receive Channel 7, my wife was disappointed that she could not watch the 'Carols in the Domain'. Also, the bath could not be filled by the bath tap, she had to fill it by using the shower. Other than these 2 'litle' problems, and after reading many of your previous guest reviews, I believe that your Management and Staff have done a great job, in improving this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Mercure, Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superbly located - right outside the train station but not too deep within the seedy heart of Kings Cross, so it still felt reasonably safe. The Guest Services staff were extremely courteous, friendly and eager to help promptly... and I was able to check in very early which was most convenient. The restaurant breakfast was satisfactory, but as there are plenty of places to eat nearby, fussy eaters will still be able to find something to saisfy them.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night here so we could go to Foo Fighters, can't complain about the position of the hotel, its in the heart of the cross and close to all public transports. My only thing was our room had a door to the next room as can obviously be used as adjoining rooms and we heard everything from next door which was quite irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Metro, Newly refurbished, Chic Deco, Clean”
Reviews.Author: jackykk
Reviews.Content: King's Cross Station is just outside the hotel across the street; the bay view room is excellent; service is great; very clean and tidy room; all deco still looked like brand new;

Reviews.Title: “Located in grotty Kings Cross not Potts Point.”
Reviews.Author: jayelcee
Reviews.Content: The advertising for this Hotel is grossly misleading and downright dishonest. It is in the heart of sleezy Kings Cross and no where near Potts point. I would not have stayed here had I known the true location. On protesting I was upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly Hotel - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and not too small. Bathroom was clean but a little dated. Room rate for the night was good compared to other similarly rated hotels in the CBD Service was genuinely friendly and staff were happy to help. As a business guest - hotel was good value for money and provided a good nights sleep which is very important when you are working.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Vinylstatistics
Reviews.Content: If you want a basic hotel in this part of town then this will fit the bill. Staff are all good and flexible. Interior is interesting but the rooms are comfortable and clean. It is right above Darlinghurst Road but if you don't mind the noise you won't mind the location. I would not recommend it for business unless you have to be in Potts Point and it is not really that great for families, but stopover in Sydney will do just fine

Reviews.Title: “to forget at soon at possible.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: not really friendly desk... not to mentionned the restaurant for the breakfast where waiters prefere to meet in the kitchen than to provide food to the customers. Absolutly not a good quality for value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Evaluation”
Reviews.Author: SergioSequeira
Reviews.Content: Next to Darlinghurst Road, Mercure Sydney Potts Point is located in a "cool" section of the city. The entrance is a little weird in a back street and you have to go to the second floor for checkin in, but that is all right. The region is filled with young people, several places to eat nearby as well as a very nice supermarket. The hotel itself is fairly appropriate. We stayed there twice within a month period and both times got a very large modern room, very decent bed, convenient fridge, extremely nice view overlooking the city and a TV with a wide range of stations. They offer free room newspapers every day and have a "restricted free wi-fi" (meaning you can only access the internet for 30 minutes per day) in the lobby. The only problem we faced the second time around was the shower pressure. We complained several times to no use. They said they were sorry, tried to fix it, offered us a drink on the house, but didn't fix it. That was the down point. The room rate was a bit on the high side but that comes with Sydney where hotel prices are not low.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room's need major renovations, bathroom door didn't have a door handle. Staff are very professional though. Also its very strange how none of the room enable room the configuration of 2 double beds. Lift's were really slow also, i took the stairs a few times. and chef's use the guest lifts?!

Reviews.Title: “AT THE CROSS IN SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Driving to this venue from the airport was quite a mission especially if you do not know Sydney streets. There are many ONE WAY streets that it took us nearly 2 hours to finally find our way through to Victoria Street. Even then the carparking directions were non existent requiring to go to the reception desk to seek directions. Paying $25 per day for parking was a bit steep but we felt even more ripped off when entered our tiny room without a desk for the laptop computer and so compact that moving within the room without bumping into each other was unavoidable. On booking this room, I felt that the room would be a lot more comfortable than it really was...I dont believe we got our money's worth although the complimentary breakfast was nice. In fact we checked in only for one night and felt that we could have claimed our complimentary night here. However, that was declined as we were charged nearly

Reviews.Title: “Accomodation at Mercure Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the room to be very ordinary, would have thought that the bed would be at least a king size. Only one chair in the room, so one person had to lie on bed most of the time. The bathroom was very small and the lighting was inadequate. Also found it a bit difficult getting out of shower with nothing to hold on to. We had a very nice view of the harbour and opera house but had to pay an extra $40 for the privelage....Also thought it to be very impersonal not having reception on the ground floor. Did not get to speak to anyone unless you got off the lift at the 2nd floor....

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade for the Views”
Reviews.Author: Howullie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at a bargain, non amendable, rate but getting worried about reports on Trip Advisor that it was noisy, requested an upgrade. This was allowed at only A$20 per night and boy was it worth it. The room, on the 13th floor, was large and delightfully decorated and the views over Sydney and Rushcutters Bay were quite astounding. Mind you noise from the Kings Cross area can still be heard at this level and it might pay the hotel to instal double glazing. We spent 6 weeks touring Australia and this was, by far, the best hotel of all.

Reviews.Title: “Mary Poppins”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This motel is in a good location for accessing Sydney city. It is right above Kings Cross station. It is right in the middle of a great entertainment area. One down fall is the hotel carpark. If your a guest you still have to pay, $25 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. All the young staff was very attentive and helpful. The menu in the diningroom was was excellent, the food divine . It was a very pleasing stay and I would certainly recommend your hotel and I will certainly stay there again on another visit to Sydney. Very pleasing to meet such young and attentive staff. Cheers, Aase McArthur

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a nice modern foyer within a great location in Sydney, walking distance to many areas, convenient bus out the front to Circular Quay. Hotel room is clean but not spectacular with windows you cannot open. Plenty of Food and Cafe options and staff were very relaxed and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at The Mercure Potts Point, And I can thoroughly recommend it to anyone. The Kings Cross train station is right over the road which was very handy for our sightseeing .Darling Harbour , Harbour Bridge etc are all only 2-3 stops away. The hotel is very clean, and we found all the staff to be always helpful, friendly and polite. This was our first ever trip to Sydney . And I would stay here again if and when we should return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: nattym_20
Reviews.Content: I have never left a negative review before however recently I had a 4 night stay between the 27/10 - 31/10, and I was absolutely mortified by the customer service experience. We booked months in advance at a discounted rate through a promotional company, we were given a reservation number and assured that this would be sufficient as a booking reference. When we arrived in Sydney we called the hotel from our shuttle bus just wanting to double check the address and were told that we didn't have a booking, they transferred us to the CBD Mecure and told us our booking must be with them, the CBD Mecure then transferred us back saying they also had no record of our booking. After being transferred back to the Potts Point Mecure, we were told "Actually you did have a booking but you were meant' to arrive yesterday", after I told them that there was no way I gave the incorrect date as I had already purchased flights before making the booking, she referred me to the manager on duty. She was extremely rude and changed the story again stating that our booking was for August, and that they did have the rooms available but not at the rate we had booked at, I said " Look we are almost there now I'll discuss it with you when we arrive, to that she replied, "You can do what if you want, but I'm telling you now you're not getting those rates". When we arrived at the hotel we were referred straight to the manager, who again wouldn't budge on the rates and blamed us for the mix up, she informed us that her desicion was final, as were tired from our flight we reluctantly agreed to pay the higher rate however we did state that we didn't think it was entirely fair and informed her we intended on following it up with consumer affairs, to which she replied, "Threats won't get you anywhere". I was extremely surprised that in a company as large as Mercure, could allow a staff member to show such blatant disregard towards a customer complaint as well as a complaint against their company. The next day I read the reviews on trip advisor and contacted the division rooms manager, which in all honesty was great and showed the first bit of customer service we had encountered since arriving at the hotel, after reviewing the situation he agreed to honor the original rates as booked. In addition to the reservation issues I found the room's cleanliness wise were also a little disappointing, with little things like no bin liners as well as used wine glasses not being removed for several days. Other than that the hotel is in a fantastic location, it was a little noisy at night but we had anticipated that being that we were staying so close to darlinghurst rd.

Reviews.Title: “Potts Point/Kings Cross gem”
Reviews.Author: Dawn L Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within easy distance from the city centre as well as the major shopping centre of Bondi Junction. I especially appreciate being assured of secure parking. Staff were most obliging, room clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Ka H
Reviews.Content: I managed to get into the hotel when everywhere else in Sydney was booked out, so I'm very grateful for that. It is definitely more Kings Cross than Potts Point but if you stick to Victoria Street and not Darlinghurst Road, the place is lovely to walk around. I also liked that Coles was almost next door. It was great for catching taxis and the service was great. A little bit expensive but then I got accomodation when I needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: ajw070662
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel one night 29/10/11 this was a saturday when it would appear the whole of Sydney come to Kings Cross ( this hotels is not in Potts Point definately Kings Cross). In the day the area looks run down with alot of homeless people wandering the streets but at night the area comes alive. It is the red light and party district of Sydney, the roads are grid locked with traffic trying to get into the area and we had someone playing the bongo drums outside the hotel from 10pm to 5am the next morning!! Having said this the hotel and staff where great, our room although on the small side had great views of the Opera House and the Bridge. Definately a hotel to stay in if you want a good time but not suitable for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service, Room are dated”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location which really suit me and my friend for 4 days trip in Sydney. Minutes to shop and transport. Big tick on that. Quick check in, no problem but need to put down credit for fund holding?? Really down side is the rooms we allocate to 2 different floors due to high booking. My friend stay on level 10 which is well furnished with new furniture and carpet. Excellent condition. I am staying in level 5 which the room like 198x models.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We live in Sydney but friends and I stayed on a Saturday night so we could beach, shop and party. Stylish hotel, great scene. Right in the middle of plenty of cool cafes (eg, Tropicana), coffee shops (eg. Bar Coluzzi) and nightclubs (eg. Hugo's, Beach Haus, Kit & Kaboodle, Soho). Could come and go all day/night. Great parking too and right near Kings Cross station. 2 person room but easily enough room for 4, if only they had double double rooms! It's so hard to get a four person room in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3 day stay at the Mercure, Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for 3 days and during our time there, found the staff to be very friendly, polite and efficient. We were pleased to see that extra personal touch, when asked if we'd like a coffee at start of breakfast in the restaurant, rather than pointed in the direction of the coffee dispenser. The room was comfortable and kept cleaned daily by staff, with an excellent view of City lights, and very handy to bus and train transport. Only one station away to the CBD, or a pleasant walk if you don't use the public transport. We'll definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't eat there!”
Reviews.Author: GrantBNewcastle Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Berfore I start I'd like to comment on some of the complaints from other travellers. Street noise: I stay Monday/ Tuesday nights so this is not an issue but later in the week it certainly would be. It's the Cross - what do you expect. Lift noise: yes this is a problem so remember to ask for a room away from the lift. The hotel itself is great and I'm a frequent user. Staff are very friendly (especially Erin), beds are the most comfortable I slept in for this price range and parking costs are very reasonable at $25/night. However, both my experiences at the restauraunt have been terrible. After the first meal I stayed clear for 6 months but last week thought I'd give it another go with a different dish. Big mistake, just as bad as the first. I wrote an email to the manager politely telling of my experience - no response! So do yourself a favour and eat elsewhere. Don't let this review tarnish the Haymarket Mercure. Meals there are first class!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An upgrade to a room with a 'city view' ($20.00) actually meant looking at the view on the main drag of the Cross, which was pretty entertaining. While the address states Potts Point, I'm sure it's Kings Cross

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was dirty. Appeared had not ben cleaned. Lifts had stopped working and had to use fire esape to gain access and exit. Difficult to gain access into the building. Car is on first serve basis - if there is no park available need to pay $100 per night for security parking or else park on street if you can find a park.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not a Four Star”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: This is a bare bones property which leaves a lot to be desired. Rooms are on the spartan side, although clean. Bed is highly uncomfortable, can't imagine where they found those mattresses but they are awful. Sheets are rough and of low thread count. Worse than the rooms themselves are dreary, completely cold and austere hallways which give the place a gloomy outlook. This hotel is generously three and a half stars, maybe even three. The Kings Cross location is a double edged sword. It is colorful and exciting, but also can be quite loud at the same time. Can't think of a compelling reason to return, even price. And speaking of prices, daily internet access for in excess of $25/day (and with high data use could be significantly more) is nothing short of outrageous. Would avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Visiting friends and family in Sydney over a long weekend. Hotel immediately opposite Kings Cross railway station so no bother getting there. Rooms were of a good standard with everything required for a leisure traveller, good service in the restaurant for breakfast and for check in and check out. Perfectly situated for the hectic city life of Kings Cross!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: Barnacles70 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Situated in very seedy Kings Cross but across William Street there is a good selection of restaurants. Close to railway station and a pleasant walk to the art gallery, the city etc. Hotel starting to show its age but we had a good view of the city. Preferred open window to aircon but noisy outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in good location”
Reviews.Author: aussiefamilySydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a Saturday and were very happy with the friendly service, especially from Joe at reception. The location is perfect for a night out in Kings Cross right in the middle of all of the action but just a short train trip into the city.The room was spacious and we had a great nights sleep in the comfortable bed. We will definately stay again and highly recommend the Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “thanks great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great service very very relaxing rooms pleasent staff great views of the harbour spotless rooms amazing food to top it off got a free upgrade for free was a pleasent surprise great secure parking staff always had a pleasent smile cheers thanks you i will be back again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great location dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had two rooms booked and saw two very different sides the hotel, the room i was given was dated and the bathroom was scary to say the least the drains in both the basin and the bath were not clean, i wanted to have a bath as the the erratic water temperature was very unsetteling (boiling hot one second freezing cold the next) there was a massive hole cut into the wall of the shower (so the plumber could access pipes?) that was then attached to hinges and put back in place. The second room that we had was the total opposite and had been refurbished and the bathroom clean, but stilll the same issue with the water temperature. The staff at reception on checkin were great, Erin and another young lady, the breakfast staff were very friendly aswell but they do need to keep an eye on the food that is out and remove it once it starts to look less than appealing. On checkout we had a young gentleman and his service was great until the phone rang half way through prcessing our checkout, he answered it and proceeded to talk on the phone leaving us there to wait until the call was finished to compleat our checkout. As i work in the industry i notice these things and they may seem small to another guest, All of these issues aside the reception area looks amazing and the location is great we were able to walk into the CBD and back.

Reviews.Title: “Little bit noisey”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was very good but the first night due to the air conditioning venting outside and not being internal caused a lot of outside noise being heard in the room. Also airconditioning vent blow straight on you while in bed.

Reviews.Title: “funky and fresh”
Reviews.Author: mon-22 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good to see Mecure has produced something modern, cool and new - rather than the stock standard conservative interior. Its edgy and functioninal, and as usual has the reliably good service you assosciate with the accor hotel brand. handy location - though is possibly more kingscross than potts point. The train station is immediately across the road making for easy travel around the city. Rooms (delux) are spacious and well decorated, with a good view of the city and partial harbour. Seems some effort has been put into the place - only let down for the new concept was some of the tiling around the bath - old or in need of a good scrub (but in the big sceme of things thats pretty minor). Would highly recommend for a city stop over and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this property where very nice and modern. King beds are king split. Nice size TV. Personally, I did not like the bathroom. It was very old looking, and didn't match with the bedroom section of the room. Very small. Old style bath. Shower head not great. Toilet roll was placed below drain pipe so you had to literally turn around and bend all the way down to access it. Lobby was beautiful and modern. Car parking was easy to find (not easy to access if late at night and no one is manning the desk constantly - i had to park in driveway, go into hotel, up elevator and wait til someone was in reception, then go down and park the cark). Street noise can be heard on Friday/Saturday nights, but it in the Cross so that is to be expected. This hotel isn't on my list of hotels that I must go back to, but it was a very nice hotel (except for the bathroom). Nothing wrong with the hotel, just personal preference/opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient and excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZer75 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surpised by the great view from our room on the 10th floor. We could see the Harbour bridge and the water. The room was not large but very well equipped. We selected it because it was walking ditsance to collect our rental car the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy W
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here on a Lastminute.com secret hotel deal, so we didn't know where we were staying until we paid. I had to drive for three hours to get to the hotel and wasn't sure of the location but the hotel staff were helpful with directions and I found it with no trouble. The reception staff were wonderful and gave us a room on the 14th floor with views out toward the harbour and the Heads. Amazing!!! The room was clean, and comfortable although lacking in furniture - we had to eat on our beds. A table would have been nice as there was enough room. However, that is a small gripe. The hotel's service was exceptional. A bottle of wine was included in our deal and when I phoned reception to ask for it, it was brought up in five minutes. In other places I've had to wait forever and make at least two more phone calls, so this sort of service was a very pleasant surprise! Also, I had to find a post office but not only did the staff find me a stamp, they offered to post the card for me. Very nice people! I thoroughly recommend this hotel. We were staying mid week and quite high up so the noise from Darlinghurst Road was minimal. We were across the road from Kings Cross station so just one train stop and you're in Martin Place - the location was excellent! Will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Makaroni
Reviews.Content: We were offered a 4 night special at very good rates on Wotif. On arriving, the man at the desk was not very welcoming, and rattled off instructions we couldn't follow. He demanded ID and a $200 bond on our credit card. On leaving, the desk woman was very helpful and pleasant. Our room was on the 3rd floor, right opposite the lifts. We were there mid week, and had no trouble with noise, inside or out, Our room was clean and spacious, the queen bed comfortable, with four good pillows. Our only problem was the bathroom,it was like a hospital one, with an open shower, and a flexible shower hose, The shower rose was faulty, and water poured from the above and little actually out of the rose. The floor became awash, the tiny bathmat couldn't cope with mopping up all the water, and I was very nervous using the hairdryer standing on such a wet floor,. There was nowhere to put anything , no shelves or hooks to keep clothes etc out of the water. We had to ask for a plug for the basin, and it didn't fit well, so the water drained out quickly. Despite this, we enjoyed our stay, the weather was perfect, the rail station was over the road, and no shortage of cafes, restaurants and supermarkets. nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Review of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the location and proce via accor was excellent. a gym at the hotel was been great also. we travelled to attend the football, which the hotel location meant we could walk to. i would have used a room bar facility of it had been available.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There should be a warning on this hotel when you book, that it is surrounded by nightclubs, as the noise levels were high outside until about 3 a.m., but we were staying at a weekend so maybe it was more noisy. Take ear plugs which might help you get some sleep. It is in a great location to explore nearby Paddington etc. The views of the harbour bridge and Opera house were great and the staff in the hotel were very helpful and provided great service. Diner was excellent but unfortunately breakfast was poor as the Buffett consisted of several hot plates of dried up eggs, bacon, beans etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views of Sydney Harbour and Skyline”
Reviews.Author: Sporthead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a one night stay here. Check in was very efficient. Staff at front desk very friendly and helpful. The standard rooms are very small but it was sufficient for our needs. We just wanted a room to sleep at the end of the night. The bed was comfortable enough. We had the added bonus of a magnificent view of the Harbour Bridge and the city skyline. To me this was surprising as we were only on the third level. This alone was worth what we paid for the price of the room. The hotel is very central to all the dining and entertainment that Kings Cross has to offer. I would recommend this hotel to any short staying guests. If you're travelling for more than a day or 2, the standard room might feel a bit cramped for you, if you have kids forget about it! but definitely a good choice for solo or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed for the amount paid for the room and think the mercure is great value for money.Â  The location is fantastic. Literally above kings cross rail station so access to the city is very easy. A couple stops on the train or a ten-minute walk. Airport access is easy as well. A huge array of restaurants, cafes, bars and other outlets are literally on the doorstep of the hotel. Kings Cross is the so called 'red light district' of Sydney yet the hotel feels very secure. You need your keycard to access the accommodation floors at all times and to gain access to the building after 21:00.Â  We were in a party occupying six rooms and were spread over the thirteenth and fourteenth floors. All rooms were refurbished and had comfortable beds and earthy tones. Rooms were clean and relatively spacious and all seemed to offer a nice view. Â The only downside was a lack of furniture. For example there was just one chair in our room. Some other rooms in our party had no chair at all. There is literally nowhere for a visitor to sit other than the bed. Â Each room only had two pillows as well but I guess you could ask for more via housekeeping.Â  We were staying over a weekend and luckily found the property to be very quiet. Â Rooms are well soundproofed from external noise and we didn't hear any commotion in the corridors.Â  All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The public areas are very nicely furnished. Â Wired and wireless Internet were both available but at a cost. 2hrs was A$10. There were also some PC's in the lobby which were A$2 for twenty minutes.Â  There is no pool or gym onsite but guests have access to the Fitness First gym located directly across the road from the Mercure for A$5 per visit. Â This was a huge plus for us as we are both gym buffs and fitness first is an exceptional facility with a huge array of equipment located over three floors.Â  The breakfast buffet was very average and not particularly inspiring. Â There was quite a limited selection and the hot options were just pre prepared food in the warmers. Â No eggs made to order etc. Though not too bad value at A$25. I'd recommend going to one of the nearby cafes of Potts Point though which do amazing breakfasts for a similar price. Provided the price was right I would definitely stay at the Mercure Potts Point if I visited Sydney again and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Opera House and Harbour Bridge views”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaw14
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to book a room on 8th floor with fantastic views of the Domain, City, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The room was quite spacious and allowed us to entertain some friends visting from the USA. Room was well equiped including Iron, and Ironing table plus fridge full of drinks at reasonable prices. Bar was also reasonably priced and enjoyable atmoshere. Did not try dining room but the menu appeared reasonable, and varied in price and choice of food. The hotel has own car prk which costs $25 per day with no limit on exits and entries which is a real saving for Sydney. Just a few meters from Hotel entrance is the entrance to Kings Cross Staion were there are trains and Light Rail giving easy acces to the city and other points of interest. TIP: Buy a Day Ticket which allows use on Train, Light Rail, Bus & Ferry - but NOT the Monorail. Room just great and spotlessly clean every day it was serviced (we stayed four nights). Some very reasonable restaurants and fast food joints in close proximity - just meters away. This is the entry point to Kings Cross with it's diverse nightlife and culture. The hotel is suituated on corner of Victoria Street and Darlinghurst Road, Hard to find a spot to park to make your booking in, best bet is Victoria Street. Staff at all levels extremely helpful and I have already reccommended this hotel to friends and aquaintances. Will definitly stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location next to train station, walking distance of Wolloomooloo, near many restaurants, friendly staff, plenty of space in room, bathroom clean, parking safe undercover. Very good for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Bad sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too close to the action of Sydney's Kings Cross and the noise was prevalent all night making sleep impossible. I will never stay there again and if this is the best Accor have to offer then I won't be renewing my membership.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: karlyrob
Reviews.Content: From the minute my sister and i entered the hotel we were greeted with friendly and helpful staff, the hotel it in such a good location with the Kings Cross Station just nearby and this made travelling around so easy, we went out to Bondi and into the city on the train. The rooms are nice and my sister said that the beds were the most comfortable she had ever slept on, we well definetly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: wend0100 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband last Sat night and wasn't quite sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews on the hotel, but we were both very pleasantly surprised! The hotel is in a top location and an easy walk to the city trains/ buses etc. I had paid extra for a harbour view room and what a splendid view it was from our room on the13th floor. Absolutely stunning and a huge room too.with a great bed. Perfectly adequate breakfast next morning. Very friendly & accomodating staff and all in all a really lovely stay. Thankyou. Am sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay near Rose Bay for a birthday party. This hotel is easy to get to, good parking, friendly and courteous staff, very comfortable, spacious room with lovely view. Good value restaurant - great food. Good value accommodation. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just a plain hotel room. Nothing particularly special, beds were decent though.”
Reviews.Author: lisahmarie
Reviews.Content: Just a plain hotel room. Beds comfy, bathroom tidy but cramped - just somewhere to sleep!! Right next door to train station - Bonus!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Saturday. Room is small and simple. By the way, it 's very near to King Cross Train Station. Stay here, If you want the hotel very near to train station and having location in CBD. However, it has noisy sound at night according to night club around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Shocking”
Reviews.Author: pizzalover85
Reviews.Content: I was checked into the hotel Thursday night and when I got to the level 8, I realized that I was assigned into Room 812, the room just opposite the lift. I called the hotel reception instantly and got told that it was fully booked the night but I could go to the reception to get another room the next morning. So there I was, woke up all the time during the night as people using the lift and talking in front of my room. The next morning I went to the reception at 7:30 and was told by a girl that all the room of the type were booked so I had to pay $60 per night extra to upgrade. I told her that I talked to the reception and was asked to go in the morning. She acknowledged the fact by saying there was a note by their staff to â€œdiscuss about the roomâ€�. I told her that she was forcing me to pay by doing that and asked to see the manager. She suddenly told me she could give me the upgrade first then talk to the manager later. I was given Room 1015. Thatâ€™s just a start. I went to Room 812 to get my stuff and put it to Room 1015 then went to the reception to return the Room 812 key card. I donâ€™t know whatâ€™s wrong with me (might be not much sleep for the night?), but I went to the 12th floor after I selected in the lift and went directly to Room 1215, yet I still realized until I found it was not my room â€“ There was an envelope on the desk written â€œMr. T. Dâ€�(not writing down the full name for privacy) . Luckily the guy checked out already otherwise it would be a disaster for the poor guy to see someone got into his room at 7:40 in the MORNING. I went to the reception directly and told the reception guy and requested to see the manager immediately, for the sake of everyone staying in that hotel. I was asked to wait as the manager was upstairs â€œcheckingâ€�. Later on this guy came up and the reception guy told me he was the manager. The reception guy went to the manager and the two had a conversation and the manager came to me, looking at me who I expected to say hello at least? No! He just walked to the computer and started checking the computer and kept talking to the reception and looking at me now and then but no hello, no sorry, nothing! Couple minutes later, I guess after he has made sure that I was correct, he came to me saying â€œI am sorry but as you known that we are not responsible for the key card system and it seems there is something wrong with thatâ€�â€¦ I said â€œglitchâ€�? He said yes that he would look into it then I asked him about the upgrade to the Room 1015. He told me itâ€™s ok and just asked me to come back to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Why do so many hotels have trouble with bathrooms?”
Reviews.Author: mrdom
Reviews.Content: I'd call this a decent hotel - once you locate the reception, everything was fine inside (I got no road noise but I was up high, with a great view of the city) except that the shower couldn't keep a constant temperature, going from cold to scalding. I've been in plenty of fancy hotels where the water took several minutes to get warm (Blue at Woolloomooloo tops the list at about 5 minutes) and now I'm seeing another side of bathroom philosophy in central Asia, but for a hotel like the Mercure to make my shower actually painful is unforgivable.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ICTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night for business trip, When checking in, had the incorrect details, One room not ready, which was not a problem, but when checked into second room, another deposit of $100 was taken. So instead of paying $218, total amount deducted for rooms was $418 on the assurance the deposit would be given back, Upon checkout this morning, no record of the deposit, & staff could not verify. During the stay, dealt with two separate assistant managers, James & Sam. Both were extremely rude to both myself & traveling party. The room was tired and dated. Would not stay here again, hope other guests are treated with the respect they deserve.

Reviews.Title: “very noisey didnt get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: georgina a
Reviews.Content: great location nice room but no insulation could hear everything from outside

Reviews.Title: “We would go back”
Reviews.Author: Tassiegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of a trip to Sydney for business and family visiting. It was extremely convenient for our needs, and as it had an excellent deal going at the time we decided to try it. We had a refurbished 8th floor room with Harbour Bridge, Opera House and city views. Didn't try the bars or restaurant, one night we had a room service meal, which was fine. Staff were pleasant, some minor issues satisfactorily dealt with. No noise issues, inside or out ! We would return if a similar situation arose, and happily recommend it as comfortable and handy accommodation on the city's eastern fringe.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome break from Christchurch”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - we caught the train from International Airport and headed to Kings Cross station, as this was the closest station I could find to the hotel. Emerging from the underground we were pleasantly surprised to find the hotel over the road from the train entrance - perfect, as we intended to make full use of the public transport system. Booking in was a breeze and we headed to the 6th floor to our room. Our room looked out over the city towards the harbour bridge and sydney opera house - fantastic view especially at night with all the lights. Had a bit of trouble with the room safe, but that was quickly sorted by a staff member. All in all a great place to stay - fantastic local restaurants within walking distance. Only one wee grizzle - room service tended to forget a few little things like replacing the full range of linen (one day we didn't have hand towels and floor mat, the next we had no facecloths) but not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, a great value Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosscoe68
Reviews.Content: Have stayed so far about 14 nights at the Mercure Potts Point. Staff are fantasic, rooms are clean and good value. Prefer the newer updated higher floor rooms over the lower floor ones. Views on both sides are wonderful, but of course the view over the city, bridge and opera house always win out. Kings Cross has some great nightclubs and resturants, easy to get into the city ( hotel above Kings Cross railway station ). Great value hotel in Sydney, with great staff. Erin, Mathew and Sarah at front desk are wonderful The only negitve would be the breakfast is really not worth the money, so many other great places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!!!! Would come back for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: Marcussss
Reviews.Content: Great location in King Cross, just right beside the train station. If you enjoy. Some how reception is on level 2 but not ground floor. Hard to move heavy luggage beware. Very quick check in even arrive hotel at 8am. Room is ready for check in. Room size is big, window can open so plenty of fresh air. Room is clean and well decor. Did not try room service as there is a lot resturant around that area. Cheap and good quality food. Overall, very pleasant stay, staff very friend and always have smile all around. Will come back in Oct again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dobbo1007 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked and then read some reviews and I was getting concerned but it was GREAT VALUE for money and convenient to walk down hill into city, catch train and parking was reasonably priced. On 12th floor and heard no street traffic or noise. Will definitely stay again. Food reasonable price and hubby loved the antipasto plate.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Total stay was very nice . parking car is very hard and hard to get the parking. Front office service was the best in total stay. Hope you guys will do something about the parking. Location was really cool and easy to access all the shops and public transport and thank you Mr Jason Kim and Team.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay and reception was very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: barbarellahutch
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here for a night due to a hospital stay and for the rate (which we got through wotif) we were pleased with the hotel. It's basic but satisfactory and Erinn on the front desk was friendly and very helpful which we appreciated since my mum is temporarily in a wheelchair. The room was clean and all the ammenities were satisfactory. They had a bath in the room which is good to note, as most hotels only have showers. On the negative side, there were only 2 pillows, they definitely need two more or something you can prop behind you whilst sitting up in bed. The only other complaint we had about the room was the smoke alarm which flashed green lights all night. Kind of like a baby UFO hovering above your bed. For a big hotel they'd do well to add some channels to their network such as FOXTEL or some kind of a movie channel. It's a fairly standard feature to have. I'd definitely stay here again if the need arose. Once again, we were very happy with Erinn who was helpful, professional and sweet. Thank you. It was a little noisy, even on Level 10, but it is Kings Cross so it's completely to be expected!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable which was all I needed for a brief visit to Sydney. The room had a great view of Sydney City, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. I was only there for one night so did not use any hotel facilities or experience the bar or restaurant. Unfortunately, a tour group were accommodated on the same floor as I was, and they made rather a lot of noise in the evening and early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SybilWyndhamNSW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic, although entry to hotel resembles walking into a brothel, dark ad sleezy with lifts to the second floor to reception. Our room had only one chair. The bedhead was obviously for a kingsize bed, but we had a queen. During our stay, the cleaners "forgot" to clean glasses and top up. The breakfast was awful. Streaky bacon, undrinkable coffee from machine and very limited choice of food. For $387 for 3 nights including breakfast and Rushcutters Bay views, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the location above Kings Cross Railway Station. The room was very large and had a great view of city, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Bathroom was dated but had everything I needed. I got a 50% off deal so excellent value for $80. Nice to be able to open windows too.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: SydneyCath
Reviews.Content: the rooms are compact but not too small, the water really hot and on a really cold weekend that was a huge plus. No inroom bar but there was coffee and tea etc. The view was excellent for the price we paid. we had a city view and could see the harbour bridge, opera house, St Marys Cathedral, all of the note worthy tourist spots. Great weekend. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back..”
Reviews.Author: Can_Dee77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and had to book each night separately as my partner and I were in-between moving houses. Upon check-in the girl at reception had asked for a credit card, without any notice she'd tried to pre-authorize my card of $250 which I cannot understand as the room was $109 and bond on the card should only be $50-$100. Had the transaction not gone through I would not have been made aware of this. Was happy to pay in cash for room + bond in the end and she had asked for $3xx (sorry I can't recall exactly)..not only did we not get a receipt each time we extended our stay but nor did any of the receptionist had picked up that on our first night there our bill had been posted for 2 nights accommodation instead of the 1..hence why my partner had overpaid in cash on at least 3 separate occasions. Prior to myself booking a second night to extend I called reception to check if their internet rate would be better than extending directly with them, I spoke to a girl named Erin and she confirmed the internet rate is of more value and said if you do extend however you still have to check out of your room and check back in.
