I told her wouldn't they get a confirmation email for the booking straight away if I booked online now why would I have to do that? And she'd replied back with.."We'll see." Glad that this hadn't happen as it makes no sense AT ALL. On check out what shocked me more that we were asked to pay an outstanding amount on the bill, it was then that they'd realized there was an extra night incorrectly added onto the bill. They tried to fix up the bill and we only got $200 from the bond back for 4 nights accommodation (bond is $100 a night and we didn't use room service, parking, etc)......... although the lady who checked us out tried to fix up the bill and the hotel had tried to investigate into this, I had a call back a day later saying they had over paid us $20 or so......how does this make sense and why am I asked to pay the same outstanding amount prior to them picking up the mistakes on the bill? Their explanation was that they checked the CCTV footage and can see what colour and how many notes were being counted by reception. Is this a joke? As I was extremely unhappy with their explanation the guy I spoke to said he will further investigate into it and give me a call back. Never happened. Very unhappy this has happened and wished I got a receipt on the first night so I could at least get some of the money back.... However, the room was of good value, clean and didn't find it noisy. Definitely disappointed with the front desk stuff up..........

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad. But don't pay much!”
Reviews.Author: livmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights (a Friday and Saturday) and I was a bit nervous about it after seeing the reviews. I called up on Thursday and asked if the receptionist was able to organise an early check in as I had a business conference call to make. She said they couldn't guarantee it but as the hotel was not fully booked on Thursday, it shouldn't be a problem. She asked what time I would arrive and when I said 11am, she said that should be fine. So we arrive on Friday at 11.45am. I went up to reception to check in and the girl behind the counter (not the same person from the phone the day before) was totally unwilling to help me. She kept saying 'those rooms are not ready' without even looking at my booking. I understand that early check in cannot be guaranteed but not even attempting to help put a bad taste in my mouth. We were able to finally check in at about 1pm (an hour early so I will give them that). We were in room 805 and initial impressions were pretty good. The room was large and modern. Upon further inspection though, it was very grubby. There were marks and stains on the walls that looked like they needed a good wipe and I found hairs that weren't ours in the bath. Two bathroom tiles came up during our stay. The whole 'revamp' is a bit shoddy. I also found it amusing that the shower curtain had a sticker on it saying 'Sydney Harbour Marriott'. So I am guessing that this hotel got the 'hand me downs'. Bed was comfortable and aircon was very good. I don't mind the street noise but the hallway noise was terrible - everything echoes and you can hear every conversation. I woke up 4 times during the first night and I am not a light sleeper. I guess the annoying people checked out because Saturday night was fine. One thing to beware of is the parking situation. The parking available is in a very tight two level space. We left the hotel at about 5 on Friday night and returned about 10pm and were able to get a space. On Saturday we left after lunch and when we returned just before midnight, the parking lot was full. This meant we had to drive around Kings X at the busiest time of night and ended up parking outside a strip club hehe. It was fine for us and actually probably safer than the Mercure car park which anyone can get into if the gate is open, but it might be a hassle or quite scary for international guests or elderly people. Just something to consider. They do tell you parking is limited but it's pretty ridiculous. Also, trying to charge us for parking for that night when we told them it was full is pretty bad form. Would we stay again? Yes, if the price was right. We paid a total of $220 for both nights. The location is good if you are looking for bars and restaurants but not good if you are looking for peace and quiet and non-dodgy people. But that's Kings Cross for you! I would rate this as a mid-3 star. It's a shame because with a bit of attention to detail and a good clean, it could be up there as a really good choice. The lobby and bar area are very nice, clean and modern but the guest floors are already looking grotty for just having been revamped.

Reviews.Title: “Poor but might improve”
Reviews.Author: indi_pendent
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the hotel. I had gone through the earlier reviews so was pretty sure what to expect. Yup..got the works. half made up bed (they just put the covers over the bed hoping nobody will try to sleep on the wrinkled sheets!), no replacement of sugar and milk (2 out of 3 days), no wifi in the room (lobby wi-fi didnt work for me...ever and anyways is too overpriced), road noise all night (lots of police sirens.but being the cross what else do you expect?). But what got my goat was the last night when I had to wake up at 430 AM next morning to catch a flight. A family moved into the room next to me with kids and they kept shouting all the night! finally I had to bang the wall to get them to shut up. Not the hotel's fault certainly but didn't help the overall experience. The hotel bar and rest. was adequate though seemed over-priced. could do with more variety though. I gotta say that this hotel was not my first choice but what can you do with your office travel dept? Will definitely instruct them not to book this in the future. DJ

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: vicsqr
Reviews.Content: Hotel well appointed, and very handy to public transport (trains and buses). Rooms well appointed and good maintenance level ( including the bathroom). Staff we all very efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “If this is the last hotel in Sydney....and only then”
Reviews.Author: gowie45
Reviews.Content: Actually writing this in the Holiday Inn across the road because it's the only chance anyone staying in the Mercure Potts Point has of getting a decent value for money breakfast and some free, properly working wi-fi. Okay, they can't help the fact the hotel is in the middle of a crack den. Maybe not even the fact that a school load of Chinese school kids were charging up and down the floor I'm on at 6.30am making as much noise as humanly possible. But for business travellers this is awful. No desk space in the room, wi fi coverage is a joke and the room nice, but small. Dodge the winos and drug addicts on the street outside and do yourself a favour. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Borderline 3 star motel with a fancy foyer”
Reviews.Author: DJ898
Reviews.Content: Cheap, and great location - and that's about it. The room we stayed in was clean but hasn't been updated since the early 80's and was sparsly furnished with an odd layout to the point of feeling unfurnished. No hotel information or local area info provided in room. Single flush vintage toilet sprung a leak - which was fixed by maintenance fairly swiftly. Took 2 calls to reception to get replacement towels which got wet from the leak. Lighting in the bathroom was dreadful, and there is no ventilation so it fogged up in seconds. Breakfast buffet supplied croissants that were rock solid. Hallway had not seen a vaccum in years. Accosted by other hotel guests in the lift who had clearly not been to bed in several days. Reception staff were abrupt, and under staffed at check out time (10am). Overall I have stayed at better 3 star motels - and won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever - Fawlty Towers Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebeegreen2011
Reviews.Content: Where to start: 1. Terrible check in - 3 people behind desk. Not one friendly smile or greeting. Left us standing for ten minutes while answered phone. No apology. Girl next to Amy serve us (again no apology for wait etc). Sent us to a room with a double (we requested 2 singles). Came back down and guy behind desk unfriendly. Bathroom dirty. Beds not made properly. No compendium. No numbers or info on phone (what if there was an emergency). Despite requesting a quiet area of the hotel, we were put on the noisy side of darlinghurst road and barely slept. No extra blankets.dirty mirrors.tried to call Housekeeping but because no instructions on ph had to physically go down to reception.at 5.30am to request extra blankets.after 5.30am complaint, got upgraded to a room on a higher level. Went to take a bath - incorrect plug. Called reception to be told that there were only 50 plugs and they were all being used! In summary, rude and unfriendly staff, actual rooms are wry disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a night out in the Kings Cross area”
Reviews.Author: Go_Get_Em_Girls
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel when it was The Crest Hotel years ago.. then The Chifley & now The Mercure. The hotel has undergone refurbishment & has improved considerably since my initial stay when it was the Crest Hotel (room was skin-crawlingly awful), & then with slight improvements since it was The Chifley. We were part of a group of 6 (staying in 3 separate rooms) who were staying in Kings Cross to attend a birthday party. Check-in was pleasant & efficient. And the decor was modern & funky. The concierge was super friendly & helpful (he had an American accent). Our only issue was that we were located on different floors (we had requested that we be located on the same floor if possible). Note: The Reception is located on Level 2. We came in via Victoria St & while there is a small unattended reception desk there it can be a little confusing (Perhaps better sign posting is required?) My partner & I stayed in Room 1305, a superior Queen harbour view room with a small but adequate bathroom (combined shower/tub). The room had great views of the city & harbour bridge/opera house (shame there weren't balconies or wall to wall windows to maximise the view). The other superior Queen room (1104) was much smaller, with a slightly bigger bathroom (no tub). The std twin room (913) had 2 single kings & faced toward Darlinghurst Road. I'm not sure exactly what was done during the refurb (or perhaps it's still taking place?) but I felt that the rooms could have done with a coat of paint or at least cleaned to remove all the scuff marks etc (unless they have deteriorated since they reopened in April?) to match the "new" modern decor. The location is fantastic for a night out in the Cross & the train station is located practically underneath the building if you want to get into the city cbd (Martin Place, Town Hall, Central) &/or to Bondi Junction. As we are members of Accor Advantage Plus we did get our room rate at a fantastic price (50% off during their March Madness Promo).. so value for money was great .. however I'd hv been somewhat disappointed if I'd have paid full rate (esp as the hotel is meant to be 4 star & I had expectations knowing it had undergone a refurb). Overall .. I'd consider staying here again if it were for a nite out in the city.. but probably would prefer to stay at a 4* CBD hotel with more amenities & pool if I was with family &/or on a vacation. Parking is available at $35/nite (though limited spots).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for kids”
Reviews.Author: iwantobea
Reviews.Content: I generally enjoy my stays at the Mercure, and the decore here was quite nice, but I was disappointed by the lack of ammenties, especially to keep kids entertained. The internet access was only available from the lobby, and required ethernet plug, there was no wireless available. There was extremely limited pay TV (fox sports), so reliance on free to air was needed and they didnt even have DVD players available for rent. Overall it was an average stay, good for a solo business traveller but not families with kids

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Peachgone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made the most of some time over Easter and ventured off to Sydney for one night and picked the Mercure Potts Point based on the strength of the brand and an impossibly cheap rate promoted through a morning television show in the prior week. For $129 (including full breakfast) we had access to a clean, well furnished room with an unbelievably comfortable bed on the 13th floor above Darlinghurst Road. Granted the location is not all that great because there is not much to see around kings Cross and restaurant choice is very limited. But if you need a clean, comfortable and safe bed for the night this place is it!! By the way car parking is difficult and the rate to park in the secure underground car park is $35 - again this is relatively good value.

Reviews.Title: “The Mecure Potts Point was the perfect place to stay as it is a stones throw from everything.”
Reviews.Author: tammydownunder
Reviews.Content: We found the Mercure to be the perfect hotel for a night away from the kids. The room was lovely with a magnificent view of the sunset over the city. The room was very clean and well appointed. The bathroom, again with a view over the city, could have used a shower curtain for a bit of privacy for the female form. While the pillows were very comfortable to sit up and enjoy the view over the city, for sleeping, they were WAY too thick. Perhaps a couple of extra thinner pillows would easily solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: We decided to extend our stay in Sydney by a day after staying a week at the Intercontinental while on business. For the last minute, the price of the Mercure was great comparable to other hotels, and a lot were booked too. Turned out to be a good decision. The staff were great, and the ground floor lobby and the check-in lobby really cool. The rooms and hallways on the room floors looked like they may have been from the original hotel. The bathrooms were clean, that's the important bit. They also had Nestle's chocolate in the room too! The neighborhood is pretty lively at night, and the botanical gardens and Paddington a short walk away. The real key is the value. Sydney is expensive anyways, but for the price the Mercure really delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and right in the middle of King's Cross”
Reviews.Author: derpde
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the location of this hotel if you're going to the King's Cross area. It is located next to the train station and across the road from the Holiday Inn, about 20m off the strip. The room rate we paid though was just over half the price of the Holiday Inn. The hotel has only just opened again after a renovation, I think it used to be a Chifley hotel. The lobby and rooms had new fittings and furnishings (should have spent more money on the painters though, they've done a shocking job, especially in the hallways). The room was clean and the bathroom was new also, with very average shower pressure. The room looked great anyway. I would recommend to improve the hotel, Mercure needs to provide an in room information book - I had no clue about the facilities of the hotel or the surrounding area and had to wait at reception to ask any questions. The only other gripe I had was that there were only 2 staff on for check out - when your check out time is 10am, everyone is going to appear at reception at once. I would hope they're better prepared for this in the future. Parking in case your wondering is very rare on the street and $35 under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Amenities and poor cleaning”
Reviews.Author: RelentlessTraveller2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned if you want to be in the middle of it all at Kings Cross and great for public transport and eating out. Don't stay here if you don't want stay in an area that has strip clubs, homeless people and suspect street activities. It is lively and quite safe but not for everyone's taste. I got the impression it has just been taken over as the staff seemed to be trying to work it all out. I stayed 3 nights in a twin room (two king single beds) with my 11 year old son. The room was adequate but in need of refurbishment. The beds were comfortable. But the hotel felt like it is cutting costs. Everything at a minimum supply: pillows, tea/coffee/shampoo etc very average. I was very surprised the hotel has NO INTERNET except in the lobby on a couple of PC's or plugging your laptop into a cable. No wireless anywhere and nothing in any rooms. They say it is being installed soon. Also no gym, no pool, a sad bar and completely uninhabited restaurant. The worst aspect was the room servicing/cleaning. On arrival the bathroom smelled bad like it hadn't been properly cleaned (And no I'm not a clean freak OCD). It had a strong urine smell. On the second day when we returned the towels had not been folded, the bathroom bench had not been wiped (toothpaste in the basin) and the toilet very obviously not not been cleaned and still the urine smell remained. When i mentioned this to reception they said they would ahve it seen to straight away but nothing happened. This was the way it was the whole time. I think the cleaners are too rushed perhaps. The beds got made but that was about it. The carpet was not vacuumed and the cups and glasses remained on the bench unwashed from the night before. Crumbs from biscuits still on the table tops. I would suggest considering the vast array of hotels in the area until this one lifts its game.

Reviews.Title: “Unless ur desperate...... for emergencies only.....”
Reviews.Author: sunshinechasers
Reviews.Content: Room was ridiculously loud - even for the cross despite being on . Room was small to the point of claustraphobic. Air con was dodgy, a lot of water was wasted with the dodgy plumbing. Location was only assisted by its accessibility to the city centre. Room was the most basic with two king singles and still cost $210/night. Would give this 3stars rather than its self rated 4 and only stayed here as it was a last minute decision made 12 hrs before book in and was all we could afford that was still available.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready to open really”
Reviews.Author: donaldasher
Reviews.Content: This hotel had only been open 10 days when I arrived for a two nightbusiness trip. I paid $229 for a room with a harbour view. Upon checking in, I received a key to room 1302, and it ws quite small and really quite dirty. The walls were stained and it really looks like this hotel had done a very quick touch up job to open on time on what is a fairly rundown place. There was also no facility in the room to use a PC. I returned to reception and asked for a room where I could work and they reassigned me to 1505. This turned out to be the same style room on another floor, again without a desk or chair. The room was not exactly 4-star either. My third trip to recpetion entalied the duty manager takign over my compalint and searching for a room that had a chair and desk. I finally got a decent sized room where I could work. The room was more spacious but a bit scruffy for a newly opened hotel. One of the lampshades was cracked. As this whole procedure had added an hour, and I was hungry I thought I'd order some room service , but their all night dining menu was not available at 10.30pm! The chef had left for the evening. Man this place was becoming very frustrating. Howver, the bed was nice and the room was cool in a very humid Sydney. Breakfast proved a problem too. Firslty the attendant did not understand that Accor Advantage Plus memebrs get a 25% discount on hotel dining so I had to talk him thought it. Secondly, the range of breakfast items was far inferior to other hotesl I have stayed in worldwide, and service was lacking. Seemed every time I needed somethign at this hotel, it was'nt there. No bread for toasting, milk had run outm coffee machine failed. No plates, no glasses for juice and when they did arrive they were hot. Sounds like small annoyances but when they all add up, I was fed up. I mainly work in Potts Point when in Syndey but I stay at Mercure at Central and commute as there has not been an Accor hotel in Potts Point until this one opened at the beginning of March. I think I wil continue to stay at Mercure Sydney rather than risk the poor service and scruffy rooms,.
